common.subject_question: What subject do you want to improve today?

questions.question: Which country has the largest population in the world?
questions.explanation: As of 2023, India surpassed China to become the most populous country in the world.

questions.question: What is the capital of Australia?
questions.explanation: Canberra was selected as the capital in 1908 as a compromise between rivals Sydney and Melbourne.

questions.question: Which represents the Eiffel Tower?
questions.explanation: The Eiffel Tower is a wrought-iron lattice tower on the Champ de Mars in Paris, France.

questions.question: Which is the longest river in the world?
questions.explanation: The Nile is generally considered the longest river in the world, stretching about 6,650 km.

questions.question: Which continent is known as the 'Dark Continent'?
questions.explanation: The term 'Dark Continent' was coined by Henry Morton Stanley in 1878 to describe the unknown interior of Africa.

questions.question: What is the smallest country in the world?
questions.explanation: Vatican City is an independent city-state enclaved within Rome, Italy, with an area of just 44 hectares.

questions.question: Mount Everest is located in which mountain range?
questions.explanation: Mount Everest is Earth's highest mountain above sea level, located in the Mahalangur Himal sub-range of the Himalayas.

questions.question: Identify this famous landmark.
questions.explanation: The Taj Mahal is an ivory-white marble mausoleum on the right bank of the river Yamuna in Agra, India.

questions.question: Which ocean is the largest?
questions.explanation: The Pacific Ocean extends from the Arctic Ocean in the north to the Southern Ocean in the south.

questions.question: Which country is famous for tulips and windmills?
questions.explanation: The Netherlands is famous for its bulb fields (tulips) and historic windmills.

questions.question: Which sport is known as the 'king of sports'?
questions.explanation: Soccer (Association Football) is the most popular sport in the world, often called the 'King of Sports'.

questions.question: How many players are there in a standard volleyball team?
questions.explanation: A standard volleyball team consists of 6 players on the court at one time.

questions.question: Identify this ball.
questions.explanation: This is a basketball, typically orange with black ribs and a pebbled surface.

questions.question: Who holds the record for the most Olympic gold medals?
questions.explanation: Michael Phelps holds the all-time record for Olympic gold medals with 23.

questions.question: Standard Tennis match consists of how many sets?
questions.explanation: Matches are usually best of 3 sets, while Grand Slam men's singles are best of 5.

questions.question: Which country won the FIFA World Cup in 2018?
questions.explanation: France won their second World Cup title by defeating Croatia 4–2 in the final.

questions.question: What is the length of a marathon?
questions.explanation: The official length of a marathon is 42.195 kilometers (26 miles 385 yards).

questions.question: Which sport uses this equipment?
questions.explanation: This is a golf club and ball, used in the sport of Golf.

questions.question: In which sport would you perform a slam dunk?
questions.explanation: A slam dunk is a type of basketball shot that is performed when a player jumps in the air to score by putting the ball directly through the basket.

questions.question: Super Bowl is the championship game of which sport?
questions.explanation: The Super Bowl is the annual league championship game of the National Football League (NFL).

questions.question: Which country is the origin of Pizza?
questions.explanation: Modern pizza evolved from similar flatbread dishes in Naples, Italy, in the 18th or early 19th century.

questions.question: What is the main ingredient in Guacamole?
questions.explanation: Guacamole is an avocado-based dip, spread, or salad first developed in Mexico.

questions.question: Identify this fruit.
questions.explanation: This is a banana, an elongated, edible fruit – botanically a berry.

questions.question: Sushi is a traditional dish from which country?
questions.explanation: Sushi is a Japanese dish of prepared vinegared rice, usually with some sugar and salt, accompanying a variety of ingredients.

questions.question: Which nut is used to make Marzipan?
questions.explanation: Marzipan is a confection consisting primarily of sugar or honey and almond meal (ground almonds).

questions.question: What is the most consumed drink in the world after water?
questions.explanation: Tea is the second most consumed drink in the world, surpassed only by water.

questions.question: Which vitamin is abundant in citrus fruits?
questions.explanation: Citrus fruits like oranges, lemons, and grapefruits are excellent sources of Vitamin C.

questions.question: Identify this dish.
questions.explanation: This is a pizza, a savory dish of Italian origin.

questions.question: What is Tofu made from?
questions.explanation: Tofu, also known as bean curd, is a food prepared by coagulating soy milk.

questions.question: Croissant is a famous pastry from which country?
questions.explanation: The croissant is a buttery, flaky, viennoiserie pastry of Austrian origin, but associated with France.
